cyclone.name: PHILIPPE
cyclone.current_location: about 480 mi (770 km) E of the northern Leeward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to drift southwest then west through tonight, then turn northwest and north-northwest Sunday night and Monday, remaining east of the Leeward Islands and then lifting toward the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: No direct landfall is projected; Philippe is forecast to stay offshore east of the Leeward and Virgin Islands

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells and possible rain for the northern Leeward Islands, U.S./British Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Low chance of tropical-storm-force gusts early next week if Philippe tracks farther west
weather_observation.storm_surge: Hazardous surf and rip currents expected along exposed Atlantic beaches
weather_observation.rainfall: Showers with periods of heavy rain could produce localized flooding Mondayâ€“Tuesday
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents impacting marine and beach operations
